content:
❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Same reason as @5DN1L. Author has been given time and suggestions to refine the clash idea but has yet to do so, per the time of this review.

This is essentially a duplicate of "Sum Of Powers" by Niklex. Both problems reduce to computing 2^n - 1:
Sum of powers: 2^0 + 2^1 + ... + 2^(n-1) = 2^n - 1
Consecutive 1's: binary 111...1 (n ones) = 2^n - 1
The framing differs, but the solution is mathematically identical. Consider if the different presentation adds enough value to justify a separate clash.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Clashes requiring the same task exist:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/43047a14710c98f6d664ba762d5492492d2da
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/4993a6bcc07d0fc636847dca5e8efaee320

I understand that this contribution of mine requires altering. I am simply waiting for my contribution to be rejected, then I will revise it, then I will submit it again, when it is a unique and individual clash. Thank you for your concern and for taking the time to review my clash. :) :) :)
